comments.author: Aisling Clinch
comments.comment: Does / will this class / api only ever apply to SelectedLeavePlan? i.e. can / will evidence ever be returned for another BO? If not, I wonder should we put this API on the SelectedLeavePlanService class? i.e. in the SelectedLeavePlanService have an api called getEvidenceResults which does the for loop??

comments.author: Mark Kevitt
comments.comment: The purpose here is that the LeaveRequest has many SelectedLeavePlans, we want a list of all evidence results in particular to leave request. The List of SelectedLeavePlans particular to the LeaveRequest is used to get the list of all EvidenceResults. The LeavePlanService may not be the best place for this.

comments.author: Mahendra Dash
comments.comment:
We should not have made the DaysConverted this complex. Lets create a separate converter if we realy need a Days converter for the Length of Service Rule.
See above how the java doc is so confusing when we implmented the ILengthOfServiceConverter too.

comments.author: Mohan Pattabhiramaswamy
comments.comment: I have created a new converter for LengthOfServiceDaysConverter

comments.author: Mahendra Dash
comments.comment:
This Java doc does not convey the right message the way the interface is defined.
Interface is not doing any conversion. Instead it is evaluating a DateTime after which the employee will be eligible for a plan w.r.t the Length Of Service Rule.
So suggetions: 1. Cahnge the name of the interface. 2. Change the Java Doc too.

comments.author: Mohan Pattabhiramaswamy
comments.comment: I have changed interface name to IMinimumPeriodConverter. Regarding the javadoc I think it is appropriate because we are converting the period of length which is in long form to the date format which we required.One more thing is we are fallowing the convention of converter. If we change the comments to evaluate, then the very purpse of having a interface might invite question from reveiewers external to our team

comments.author: Trevor Higgins
comments.comment: Javadoc is now wrong. I'd suggest moving the documentation of each value onto the value, so you dont need to copy/paste the name

comments.author: Trevor Higgins
comments.comment:
Reopening as this may be causing FAB-4270.
also, does this really belong here? I thought this enum was for listing job types, like AIRLIE_FLIGHT_CREW? ON_PROBATION sounds more like a job status/category......should this not be in EmploymentCategory or EmploymentType?
If its in here, then we should rename the enum domain in my opionion, possibly to EmploymentTypeExceptions or something
Can you check with Maura.
